Google Services Google Services operating income increased $1.8 billion from the three months ended June 30, 2022 to the three months ended June 30, 2023 and increased $1.6 billion from the six months ended June 30, 2022 to the six months ended June 30, 2023. The increase in operating income was primarily driven by an increase in revenues, partially offset by an increase in compensation expenses and content acquisition costs. Additionally, operating income benefited from a reduction in costs driven by the change in the estimated useful lives of our servers and certain network equipment. Google Cloud Google Cloud operating income of $395 million for the three months ended June 30, 2023 compared to an operating loss of $590 million for the three months ended June 30, 2022 represents an increase of $985 million. Operating income of $586 million for the six months ended June 30, 2023 compared to an operating loss of $1.3 billion for the six months ended June 30, 2022 represents an increase of $1.9 billion. The increase in operating income was primarily driven by revenue growth, partially offset by an increase in compensation expenses. Additionally, operating income benefited from a reduction in costs driven by the change in the estimated useful lives of our servers and certain network equipment. Other Bets Other Bets operating loss decreased $526 million from the three months ended June 30, 2022 to the three months ended June 30, 2023 and decreased $136 million from the six months ended June 30, 2022 to the six months ended June 30, 2023, primarily driven by a reduction in valuation-based compensation liabilities related to certain Other Bets. In the three months ended June 30, 2023, we recognized $892 million of interest income and $398 million of net unrealized gains on marketable equity securities. This was partially offset by $689 million of net unrealized losses on non-marketable equity securities and $304 million of net losses on debt securities. This was partially offset by $911 million of net unrealized gains on non-marketable equity securities and $486 million of interest income. final_answer:
Operating Expenses (General and Administrative Expenses) for the last 3 fiscal years are as follows:

| Year | Operating Expenses (in millions) | Year-on-Year Change (%) |
|-------|---------------------------------|------------------------|
| 2021  | $13,510                         | -                      |
| 2022  | $15,724                         | +16.39%                |
| 2023  | $16,425                         | +4.46%                 |

This shows a consistent increase in operating expenses over the three years, with a significant rise from 2021 to 2022 and a slower growth rate from 2022 to 2023.

final_answer: The gross margin has shown an improving trend over the last three years: approximately 55.0% in 2022, increasing to 56.6% in 2023, and further improving to an estimated 61.5% in 2024. This indicates the company has been increasingly efficient in managing its cost of revenues relative to its total revenues.

final_answer:
The General and Administrative (G&A) expenses, a major part of operating expenses, for the last three fiscal years are as follows:

| Year | G&A Expenses (in millions) | Year-on-Year Change (in millions) | Percentage Change |
|-------|----------------------------|----------------------------------|-------------------|
| 2021  | $13,510                    | -                                | -                 |
| 2022  | $15,724                    | +$2,214                          | +16.39%           |
| 2023  | $16,425                    | +$701                            | +4.46%            |

- From 2021 to 2022, G&A expenses increased by $2,214 million, a 16.39% rise.
- From 2022 to 2023, G&A expenses increased by $701 million, a 4.46% rise.

This indicates a consistent increase in operating expenses over the last three years, with a slower growth rate in the most recent year, suggesting some stabilization or improved cost management.

Other Bets Other Bets operating loss decreased $78 million from the three months ended September 30, 2023 to the three months ended September 30, 2024, due to a combination of factors, none of which were individually significant. Other Bets operating loss increased $38 million from the nine months ended September 30, 2023 to the nine months ended September 30, 2024. The increase in operating loss was primarily due to an increase in expenses, largely driven by compensation expenses, partially offset by an increase in revenues. The increase in compensation expenses was primarily as a result of the reduction in valuation-based compensation liabilities related to certain Other Bets recognized in the prior year comparable period. OI&E increased $5.4 billion from the nine months ended September 30, 2023 to the nine months ended September 30, 2024. The increase was primarily due to an increase in net unrealized gains on non-marketable equity securities driven by fair value adjustments related to observable transactions and increased interest income related to higher interest rates. We determine realized gains or losses on the sale or extinguishment of debt securities on a specific identification method. We recognized gross realized gains of $116 million and $29 million for the three months ended June 30, 2021 and 2022, respectively, and $251 million and $69 million for the six months ended June 30, 2021 and 2022, respectively. The gross margin trend over the last three years is as follows:  
- 2022: 55.38%  
- 2023: 56.63% (an increase from 2022)  
- 2024: Cannot be calculated due to missing cost of revenues data  

Overall, gross margin improved from 2022 to 2023, but the 2024 gross margin is not available to assess the trend further.

final_answer: The gross margin increased from 55.37% in 2022 to 56.63% in 2023, indicating an improving trend over these two years. Data for 2021 is not available, so the full 3-year trend cannot be determined.

final_answer: The gross margin increased from approximately 55.37% in 2022 to 56.63% in 2023, indicating an improving trend. However, due to the lack of cost of revenues data for 2024, the gross margin for that year cannot be determined, preventing a full three-year trend analysis.

| Year | Operating Expenses (in millions) | Year-on-Year Change (%) |

This shows a consistent increase in operating expenses over the last three years, with a significant rise from 2021 to 2022 and a slower increase from 2022 to 2023.

query: Calculate the Operating Efficiency Ratio (Opex ÷ Operating Income) for the last 3 fiscal years.
